bibl.title: Letter from Pedro Nogueira to Philip Showalter Hench, December 13, 1954

div1.p: Nogeuria finds plans that mark the location of the American cemetery. He also is starting to form a Lazear Camp Friend's Association.

div1.head: Letter from Pedro Nogueira to Philip Showalter Hench, December 13, 1954
div1.opener:
DR. PEDRO NOGUEIRA
MEDICO CIRUJANO
MARTI 219. MARIANAO
TELEFONO: 80-7577
Marianao Diciembre 13 de 1954
Dr Philip Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnessota
U.S.A.
Dear Philip:
div1.p:
Although it is very late, in answering your letters, on
account, of my trip to Europe and then South America and the large
numbers of work, I had not been able to dedicate the necessary time.

On first place, let me inform you something which you would like
too much; why I found some plans where appeared perfectly marked the
“American Cementery”, name with which it is known.-

Beside that I have also found all the dates on Mr Socorro, who was
owner of those lands ( and that certainly he was a priest), and I ho-
pe within a few days to have a copy of the sale of them from the Ame-
rican Goverment for installing the Cementery.

Your letter says, that those lands were rented, but I understand
by these dates, that your Goverment bought them.- I have send to get
out a copy of said plan, which I will mail you right away, as well a
as, all others dates that uyoyu need.-

To complete this investigation I am waiting the return of Engi-
neer Mr Beato, who is off this city, why I am informed that this
gentleman has even more dates about all which we need, and I will
see him inmediately, to see if we can clear up all this matter, as
soon as possible.-

I want to tell you too, that this year, just the same, as the
last years, we celebrated the Official Act on December 3erd birth-
day of Dr Finlay, on the Lazear Camp, with attendance of Authorities
and childrens of the Marianao's Schools.-

It was a beautiful act and I hope that every year it will be
better.- Also let me tell you ahead, I am trying on January, to
start to work Lazear Camp Friend's Association, which I am sure,
that you will help me among your chums.-

Well Philip, I promise to write you, within a few days with more
news and meanwhile my affectionate greetings for you and Mary, and
my best wishes for the next Chistmas and a new year 1955.-
